meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating sound
meanings.sent1: The old door scroops when it swings open.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate scroops loudly when you push it.
meanings.sent3: The cat scroops as it tries to sharpen its claws on the metal chair leg.
meanings.sent4: The car scroops to a stop, its brakes squealing in protest.
meanings.sent5: The wind scroops through the trees, creating an eerie sound in the night.

meanings.sent1: The scroops of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.
meanings.sent2: The scroops of the rusty swing set echoed through the empty playground.
meanings.sent3: The scroops of the old violin strings sounded like a cat in distress.
meanings.sent4: The scroops of the metal chair legs on the floor signaled the start of the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The scroops of the train brakes filled the station with a piercing noise.
